title: battling star hold title favourites
story: Colin CameronUpdated:   , : pmLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwards.Red Star ed home with a point after a battling performance against league leaders and title favourites Arthurlie on Saturday November .Star stung the hosts at Cowan Park, Barrhead, with an excellent start to the match, forcing a succession of corners before the ever-dangerous Coll McCallum finished after an excellent delivery by Craig Aitken.The visitors doubled their lead after  minutes when Craig Aitken broke clear down the left and finished with an excellent effort into the goalkeeper’s far corner to put Star - ahead.Star were under pressure for much of the remainder of the half but always carried a threat on the break, with Stuart MacLean’s pace causing the home side no end of problems.Into the second half, Arthurlie forced their way back into the match and pulled a goal back after a rare defensive lapse by Star on  minutes. Star failed to clear the danger from a cross and the unfortunate Coll McCallum erted into his own net past Leon Murphy.The Arthurlie equaliser arrived with  minutes remaining when winger Sean Ross cut inside before unleashing a spectacular effort into the top corner.The hosts would have been expected to go on and win the game from here but the Star defence remained well-organised and resolute and a fine goalkeeping performance from Leon Murphy ensured the Lochgilphead side ed home with a well-earned point.Star put their unbeaten league record on the line on Saturday November  when they welcome fellow Argyll side Cardross to the Joint Campus G. Kick-off pm.PIC:The SAFL Division One table after last weekend#s matches. no_aStar_LeagueTable

title: argyllshire advertiser leader column november 19 2021
story: Colin CameronUpdated:   , : pmLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwards.Maybe it is a sign that the young folk causing damage at Blarbuie Woodland are maturing, but it was good to hear that some, at least, had gone back to help clean up their mess.Whatever their motivation, good on them.The night-time antics there over quite a period have been pointless, infantile and regularly dangerous. And do these kids# families not know where they are in the evenings The carrot of working with ACT, the police and wider community to create something positive is on offer for young people.But so too is the stick, eventhis is something that most would rather avoid using.Let#s hope they continue to grow out of getting kicks from damaging things which folk have put their heart and souls into creating for others.Last year#s Remembrance was strange in the pandemic.Maybe we felt the need this year to reconnect with tradition, or perhaps the past  months has offered a little insight into the infinitely more arduous trials faced by those we remembered last Sunday.The fact that so many people came out on a cold day was heart-warming.

title: red star face busby in league
story: Colin CameronUpdated:   , : pmLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwards.Subscribe NowAfter last weekend#s SAFL Division One tie away to Claremont was postponed, Lochgilphead Red Star this weekend face Busby at the Ropework park.Star currently sit in the top half of the table, having played one or two games fewer than their rivals above them in what is shaping up to be a competitive league.The match on Saturday December  starts at pm, and a good home support at the Ropework would be welcome.A win for the Mid Argyll outfit would see them move up to third in the table.

title: scotland-women-head-dubai-february-cup-qualifiers
story: THE WOMENS edition of the Rugby World Cup  Final Qualication Tournament will take place on  and  February  at The Sevens Stadium in Dubai.Scotland will compete alongside Samoa, Colombia and the winner of the Hong Kong v Kazakhstan playoff for the last remaining place at Rugby World Cup  in New Zealand, now due to take place between  Octoberndash November, .The Final Qualication Tournament will operate in a semi-final, final format over two match days.This is the first time the womenrsquos edition of Rugby World Cup has featured a Final Qualication Tournament offering teams a second pathway to qualy for RWC  with the winner booking their place in Pool A alongside hosts New Zealand, Australia and Wales next year.Eleven teams have already booked their place at Rugby World Cup , including New Zealand, England, France, Canada, USA, Australia and Wales, who qualied through their final ranking at Ireland , and South Africa, Fiji, Italy and Japan who qualied through their regions.Rugby World Cup  Tournament Director, Alison Hughes, said: ldquoWe are pleased to be able to share the details of the Rugby World Cup  Final Qualication Tournament. A first for a womenrsquos edition of a Rugby World Cup the tournament offers teams a second opportunity to qualy for the pinnacle event and we anticipate a thrilling contest between competing teams in Dubai in February.Tom Burwell, The Sevens Stadium General Manager, said, ldquoWe are hugely excited to host world-class womenrsquos XVs rugby at The Sevens Stadium. It will be the first time such a competition has taken place in the UAE. With the Emirates Dubai s ing over the next two weekends, itrsquos an exciting time for rugby in the region. We are honoured to be working with World Rugby once more in delivering international rugby. With the winner going onto New Zealand and RWC , we are excited to be part of a nationrsquos journey to the very top of the womenrsquos game..removeThe RWC  Final Qualication Tournament will be live streamed across World Rugby and RWC  digital and social s.Rugby World Cup  will be the showpiece event in womenrsquos rugby union s, with the first tickets for Rugby World Cup  selling out in minutes. Tournament organisers are calling on fans to secure their tickets early to avoid disappointment.

title: work-start-soon-gala-fairydean-rovers-stand
story: GALA Fairydean Rovers hope to reopen their iconic Netherdale Stand for the start of next season.The Peter Womersley designed building has been closed since winter  due to public health and safety concerns associated with spalling concrete.A structural assessment was initially conducted in  highlighting the required repairs needed to the stand.Concrete Repairs Limitedhas been appointed to carry out a range of improvements to the category A listed building. The work includes concrete repairs to the stand and turnstiles, drainage improvements and aesthetic enhancements around the stand to restore some of its original features.The work will be funded by Scottish Borders Council within this yearrsquos capital budget along with a contribution from the Gala Fairydean Rovers Football Community Trust.Councillor Gordon Edgar, executive member for roads and infrastructure, said: ldquoAnyone who is familiar with the town of Galashiels will recognise the iconic architecture of the Netherdale Stand and its importance to the town.ldquoIrsquom extremely excited to see work on repairing the building to its former glory progress with the appointment of an experienced contractor.ldquoEnsuring its long-term future by carrying out these necessary refurbishments will allow future generations to benefit from it andthe stand to its former glory.Murray Souter, regional director for Scotland at Concrete Repairs Limited, said: ldquoConcrete Repairs Limited are delighted to be entrusted with the refurbishment of this iconic structure and our team are looking forward to spending the spring and summer months of  in Galashiels working.ldquoTogether with Scottish Borders Council and their design team, we willthe stand to its original glory, looking great, structurally sound, and ready to cope with a full complement of excited Gala Fairydean Rovers fans.The news was also welcomed by Ross Buchan, chairman of Gala Fairydean Rovers Community Trust..removeHe said: ldquoThe stand repair project has been a long journey which began for us in October . The stand is part of our architectural and historic heritage and itrsquos listing places a duty on us, the community, to preserve the structure for future generations.ldquoWe have now reached a signicant stage on this journey, where, Scottish Borders Council have appointed of the principal contractor to carry out the works. We welcome Concrete Repairs Limitedonto the project and look forward to working in cooperation and partnership with them also.ldquoIt will be a day to celebrate when the stand is opened to the public, club and community where we can once again make full use of this very important facility.ldquoThe project has benefitted from working in cooperation and partnership with Scottish Borders Council, Historic Environment Scotland, Fallago Environmental Fund, Live Borders, Gala Fairydean Rovers Football Club, Gala Fairydean Rovers Football Club Community Trust and our very experienced design team.

title: rugby-fans-treat-weekend
story: A feast of live rugby is taking place in the Borders this weekend.There will be a huge Borders derby on Saturday when Hawick make the short trip up the A to Philiphaugh where they will face Selkirk in the Premiership. Elsewhere Jed-Forest head west to meet Glasgow Hawks.In the National League Division One Biggar host Stirling Wolves, Gala face Ayr at Netherdale, Kelso make the long trip to Inverness to face Highland and Melrose host Boroughmuir at the Greenyards.In the National League Division Two Peebles host Kirkcaldy at the Gytes.In the National League Division Three Berwick are at home to Murrayfield Wanderers.In the National East League One Duns are in the capital to face Broughton.In the National East League Two Hawick Linden are away to Leith.In the National East League Three Earlston host Edinburgh Northern.In the Reserve East League One Selkirk A face Hawick Force and Jed-Forest A face Stewartrsquos Melville in Edinburgh.In the Reserve East League Two Peebles Reds are away to Edinburgh Accies, Kelso Sharks host Gala A in a Borders derby and Melrose Storm are in East Lothian to face Preston Lodge A.On Sunday Kelso Ladies are away to Annan Ladies.Elsewhere Hawickrsquos Lisa Thomson and former Melrose player Ross McCann will feature for Team GB Womenrsquos and Menrsquos s teams in the Dubai Sevens. The group stages will be held on Saturday with the latter stages and finals on Sunday.As always check before you travel to make sure that the game is on.A round up of the results will be available on the Borderand Peeblesshire News at noon on Sunday.

title: massive-game-ahead-vale-leithen
story: VALE of Leithento Lowland League action on Saturday with a trip to face in-form Stirling University.And manager Grant Sandison believes thathis players continue with the same form that they displayed in their last two league games then they are more than capable of causing problems for the students.Vale have not played a competitive game since November  due to having been eliminated in the early stages of the South Challenge Cup and the Scottish Cup.During that break Sandison has been completing his UEFA B Licence Course at the Oriam in Edinburgh and he managed to arrange a couple of friendlies to keep the squad ticking over.Last week Vale lost - to Peebles Rovers and on Tuesday a match against Preston Athletic was abandoned due to adverse weather.Stirling have been in a good run of form recently beating Gala Fairydean Rovers - at Netherdale in the South Challenge Cup."When I first took over, they were down the bottom of the table along with Gretna and Edinburgh University," Sandison said. ldquoBut they have picked up lately and are showing consistency. They are in a good run of form and have done well, taking eight points from their last four games and are in a  position in the table.ldquoI watched them against East Stirling and had them watched against Gala so we are well briefed and I know they have some good young players but I believe thatwe can take the level of performance we showed against Bonnyrigg and Spartans then we can cause them problems.ldquoWe have a couple of things in the pipeline including a possible loan signing and hopefully it will happen before Saturday.

title: peebles-high-quality-path-network-plans-lodged-council
story: PEEBLES could be set for a number of ldquohigh quality walking trails after plans were filed with the council.Proposals to improve the current network while also creating new paths are outlined in an application prepared by Laurence Gould Partnership Ltd at the request of Benson Wemyss Farms.The current situation in the area to the west of the town is ldquonot ideal, providing an opportunity to link to other routes and improve ldquothe overall quality of the local path network.ldquoThe farm is a strong supporter of hillwalking and public access, having set up the highly successful Tweed Walk in partnership with Border Council [Scottish Borders Council], and has applied to the Agri-Environment  Climate Scheme for grant aid in order to improve public access across the farm, providing improved links and connectivity, improved path conditions and accessible paths for all, a report submitted as part of the application reads.ldquoThe farm has a number of existing footpaths that will be improved via the scheme, but the scheme will also create a number of new footpaths for users to enjoy.ldquoPeebles is rapidly becoming a destination for enjoying the outdoors and the woods around Neidpath are increasingly used as an important asset by the community.The business is proposing to ldquoincrease the value of the path network to the local community.According to the report, the new routes proposed include linking two core paths through the Jedderfield Plantation.On that plan, the papers state: ldquoThere are a vast range of heavily used paths through these woodlands that turn to mush during the winter. This project aims to make them accessible for more people throughout the year.A new path from the southwest section of South Park Wood along the edge of the River Tweed to the Old Manor Bridge is also outlined.Existing pathways to be upgraded are located throughout South Park Wood and alongside the River Tweed, along the old Symington, Biggar, and Broughton Railway line, according to the report..removeThe business farms at Edston Farm, located immediately to the west of Peebles.Holiday lets, a horse livery and a wedding venue are currently operated by the business, the papers state.

title: borders-gift-card-proposed-help-boost-high-streets
story: PLANS for a gt card that allows you to spend money at local businesses will be discussed by senior councillors on Tuesday .The national initiative is designed to help local retailers and high streets, according to papers put to the executive committee before next weekrsquos meeting.People can choose the amount of money to load onto the gt card and spend it within businesses that have signed up to the scheme, according to Scottish Borders Council .The view from the council is that the Scotland Loves Local Gt Card initiative would be ldquoworth trying considering the dficulties businesses have experienced during the COVID- pandemic.ldquoThe idea behind the gt card is to try and encourage people to spend money in the local community, thereby helping to support local businesses and the local supply chain, the report states. ldquoLike any other gt card, you can choose the amount of money to load onto the card.ldquoHowever, the key dference in this case is that the money can only be spent within the boundaries of the Scottish Borders and with businesses that have signed up to the scheme.ldquoThe gt cards will feature a -digit MasterCard number, CVV and expiry date allowing them to be used online at independent and national retailers alike, as long as the retailer has a physical presence in the local authority area and is making a contribution to the local economy.It adds: ldquoOur understanding is that neighbouring local authorities such as Dumfries and Galloway and Midlothian councils have already signed up to the scheme and East Lothian Council already had a gt card scheme in place which they believe to be worthwhile.If approved, it will cost the council around pound, annually to market and promote the scheme, according to the papers.It is proposed that SBC trials the scheme ldquoover the short to medium term.A review of the scheme will be undertaken after a full year of operation to help gauge the success of the project, with the results then presented to elected members. The gt card project was launched in July by Scotlandrsquos Towns Partnership.

title: christmas-arrives-peebles-switch-on-event
story: FESTIVE joy filled the streets in Peebles at the weekend as the townrsquos annual Christmas lights switch-on ed following the coronavirus pandemic.Visitors to the town and locals alike were treated to an afternoon filled with music and plenty of opportunities to find great gts.At .pm the lights were turned on by Paul Spence and Sophie Hamilton, the founders of the Peebles COVID- Mutual Support Group at the start of the pandemic.A spokesperson for Peebles Christmas Lights Association ndash which organised the event ndash shared on social media: ldquoThe people of Peebles and beyond you really are amazing, what an outstanding turnout this afternoon. We could not of wished for a better crowd of people.ldquoThe gamble well and truly paid off and our Association is very grateful.ldquoA huge thank you to all the stall holders and local businesses for their support today also, this would not of been possible without you all.ldquoThis is all put together and run by a small band of volunteers who have put hundreds of man hours into making this all possible, some of whom have been out since mid morning clearing cars from the street ready for the build up.ldquoThey all do this for the love of the town and what joy it brings to the town we try to keep everybody happy but sometimes this is just not possible.Musical performances on the day came courtesy of Peebles Burgh Silver Band, Peebles Ex-Servicemenrsquos Pipe Band, InChorus, and The Taylor Brothers. And stalls at the Christmas market along the High Street offered art, clothing, homewares and local produce.

title: weekend-rugby-round-up
story: The weather affected this weekendrsquos rugby card with a number of games postponed and one abandoned.In the Premiership, Hawick won the Borders derby beating Selkirk - at Philiphaugh. Kieran Clarkrsquos penalty gave the Souters the lead before Kirk Ford replied with a try which he converted to give the visitors a - half-time lead.Another Clark penalty reduced the deficit before referee Michael Todd awarded a penalty try to Hawick which Ford converted.A third Clark penalty finished the scoring.Jed-Forest travelled to Glasgow where they lost - to the Hawks. Captain Gregor Young suffered a rib injury forcing a change in formation then Paulo Ferreira saw yellow for a high tackle before Glasgow scored a converted try.Selkirk responded with a try from Lewis Young which Gary Munro converted then another penalty from Munro gave the Borderers a - lead.A converted try and a penalty from the Hawks secured the victory despite late pressure from Glasgow.In National League Division One Biggar beat Stirling Wolves - at Hartree Mill, Gala beat Ayr - at Netherdale, Kelso lost - to Highland in Inverness and the Melrose game against Boroughmuir was abandoned.In National League Division Two, Peebles game against Kirkcaldy was postponed.In National League Division Three Berwickrsquos game against Murrayfield Wanderers was abandoned.In National East League One Duns lost - to Broughton.In National East League Two Hawick Lindenrsquos game against Leith was postponed.In National East League Three Earlston lost - to Edinburgh Northern.In Reserve East League One Selkirk A lost - to Hawick Force at home and Jed-Forest A lost - away to Stewartrsquos Melville in the capital.In Reserve East League Two Kelso Sharks drew - with Gala A, Melrose Storm beat Preston Lodge - in Prestonpans and Peebles Reds game against Edinburgh Accies was postponed.In the Semi-Junior Borders League Kelso Harlequins beat Morpeth Colts - away from home.

title: covid-scotland-negative-lateral-flow-accepted-place-vaccine-passport-today
story: Negative lateral flow test resultswill be accepted in venues that require vaccine passports from today, after changes were made to the scheme by the Scottish government.Currently in Scotland you are required to show proof that you are fully vaccinatedfor entry intonightclubs, indoor live events with + people unseated, outdoor live events with + peopleunseated and any event with ,+ people.But from today a negative lateral flow test result at these venues will also be accepted.Heres everything you need to know...Can I use a lateral flow test to enter venues requiring a vaccine passport Yes, from Monday December , you can use proof of a negative lateral flow testto enter venues on the vaccine passport scheme in Scotland.Proof of vaccination will also still be accepted for these venues.If using a lateral flow test, it must have been taken within -hours prior to entry.You must report your lateral flow test result on the government website.How do I report my lateral flow test When you take your lateral flow test, you must report it on the Government website, which can be found here.You will then be sent a text or email confirming your result which can be used -negative - for entry to events requiring vaccine certication.Where can I get lateral flow tests Lateral flow tests are available for free from pharmacies and to order from the Scottish government website.Nicola Sturgeon also said that lateral flow tests would become available to collect in more venues in Scotland, including Christmas markets and sport centres.How can I download proof of vaccination You can download your vaccine passporton your smartphonevia theNHS Scotland Covid Status App.Alternatively, you can order a paper copyof your vaccine passport via yourvaccine portalor phoningthe specially designated Covid status helpline on  , open from am-pm every day..removeWill my booster jab show on my vaccine passport At the moment in Scotland, your booster vaccine will not show on your vaccine passport.However, the Scottish government has said it is working to change this as soon as possible to ensure the booster does appear on your vaccination certication.

title: social-lunches-fun-games-berwickshire-communities
story: BERWICKSHIRE Housing Associationrsquos BeFriend project is joining forces with Abundant Borders to take its Lunch Plus programme to towns and villages across the district.Abundant Borders first started Social Lunches in Coldstream in , with regular visits from BHA BeFriend ndash befrienders, befriendees and staff. Following the success of these weekly events it was decided to take these lunches to other communities across Berwickshire.With support from Berwickshire Alliance, and thanks to Scottish Government Covid Recovery Funding, this is now happening and each Thursday, Lunch Plus pops up in a dferent village! Abundant Borders staff and volunteers prepare homemade soup and sandwiches and BHA BeFriend arrange a iety of games and activities for everyone to enjoy.Karen Birch, Chief Officerat Abundant Borders, said: ldquoThe feedback has been incredible, and it is wonderful to be able to support even our most isolated villages and bring hearty food and good cheer to residents.ldquoItrsquos fantastic to be working so closely with the wonderful folk at BHA BeFriend and to be taking social lunches, fun and games to communities across Berwickshire. It is lovely to see people getting back out into their communities, meeting friends, chatting, enjoying freshly prepared food and having a bit of fun together after the couple of years that we have all had.Terri Bearhope, BeFriend Project Co-ordinator, said: ldquoItrsquos so good to be able to see people out and about again. Wersquove had fantastic feedback from people attending and we know that theyrsquore loving the chance to see old friends and meet new ones.ldquoAbundant Borders have been amazing, and their food is wonderful, second to none. The village halls have also been really supportive, not only do they let use their facilities, wersquove had committee members attending the lunches too.So far Lunch Plus events have been held in Grantshouse, Cockburnspath, Preston, Chirnside and Gordon and Foulden with others planned at Burnmouthand Greenlaw . They will also restart again in January.

title: borders-records-100-coronavirus-cases-weekend
story: THE Borders has seen a rise in cases of coronavirus over the weekend, new data shows.Updated figures were published by the Scottish Government at pm today .And the new data shows that the region saw  cases over the weekend, taking the total since the start of the pandemic to ,.:Storm Barra: Risk of more power cuts as Borders given yellow weather warningsOver the weekend Public Health Scotland were aware of a data reporting issue for results from the UK Government Pillar  lab tests. The issue was resolved, however, this could represent increased figures for today due to the backlog of cases being processed.There are currently  people in hospital in the Borders with recently confirmed cases of COVID-, according to the figures.On Friday, there were  people in hospital.Scotland has now recorded , cases since March last year.

title: new-travel-rules-scotland---changes-covid-travel-restrictions
story: More changes to the Covid travel rules in the UK have been introduced amid concerns surrounding the Omicron iant.Scientists are racing to understand more about the new iant originally identied in South Africa, with fears that it could be more transmissible than Delta.In order to try and curb the spread of Omicron, new travel rules have been imposed around the UK in a four nations approach.These rules apply to England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Irelanddue to the four nations approach to international travelthe governments have decided to take.Heres everything you need to know about travelling to the UK from abroad...Do I have to do a pre-departure test before flying to the UK From Tuesday December  at am, youwill be required to take a pre-departure test before flying to the UK.This applies to everyone over the age of , whether you are fully vaccinated or not.You must take this test within -hours before your flight to the UK departs.Do I have to do a PCR test when I arrive in the UK Yes,you are fully vaccinated you must take a PCR test within -hours of arriving in the UK.You must isolate until you receive the results of your test.If you are fully vaccinated andthe test is negative, you can leave isolation.What are the travel rules for red listed countries The following countries are currently on the red list:AngolaMalawiMozambiqueZambiaSouth AfricaBotswanaEswatiniLesothoNamibiaNigeriaZimbabwePeople travelling from red listed countries must take a PCR test prior to travel to the UK, isolate in a quarantine hotel when they arrive and take PCR tests on day  and day  of arrival.This applies to anyone travelling from red listed zones, whether vaccinated or not.What are the travel rules for people who are not fully vaccinated If you are not fully vaccinated and travelling to the UK from a non-red listed country, you must:.removetake a COVID- test ndash to be taken in the days before you travel to England book and pay for day  and day  COVID-PCRtestsndash to be taken after arrival in Englandquarantine at home or in the place you are staying for  full daystake your COVID-PCRtests ndash you mustbook these testsbefore you travel

title: direct-flight-new-york-chicago-washington-coming-soon
story: DAILY nonstop services between Scotland and the United Stateswill resume in spring next year.United Airlines will fly between Edinburgh and Newark Airport near New York from March  and will also resume daily seasonal services between Edinburgh and Chicago and Washington D C from May .Gordon Dewar, Edinburgh Airportrsquos Chief Executive said: ldquoItrsquos incredibly exciting to be resuming our transatlantic services with United to allow direct travel between Scotland and the USA for the first time in two years.ldquoIt will allow families to reunite, friends to reconnect and re-open the strong tourism destinations on both sides of the Atlantic.ldquoWe are delighted toto Scotland in  and resume nonstop services from Edinburgh to the United States, added Bob Schumacher from United Airlines.ldquoWith theof services, our customers in Edinburgh can once again take advantage of direct connections to the US, as well as an unrivalled route network from Unitedrsquos hubs at New York Newark, Chicago and Washington, DC, offering convenient nonstop connections to  destinations across the Americas.

title: nicola-sturgeon-covid-update-today-watch-live
story: Nicola Sturgeon will give her Covid update to Parliament this afternoon as Scotland continues to record cases of the Omicron iant.The iant, originally identied inSouth Africa, has caused concern around the world and prompted countries to introduce new measures to try and limit the spread.Scientists are racing to examine the potential impact of the Omicron iant which is feared to be more transmissible than Delta.In line with JCVI advice, the Scottish government confirmed last week it would offer all adults a booster jab to increase protection against the virus.Tighter restrictions on travel have also been introduced in the UK, with passengers travelling to England, Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland from abroadrequired to take a pre-departure test from today, regardless of vaccine status.The first ministers statement comes the day after changes were made to the vaccine passport scheme in Scotland, which mean that people can now gain entry to events which require vaccine certication using a negative lateral flow result.As the country continues to grapple with the new Covid iant, heres everything you need to know about Nicola Sturgeons update today...What time is Nicola Sturgeon speaking today Nicola Sturgeon will give her update to Parliament on the Covid situation in Scotland around :pm this afternoon.It will depend on the topics before running to schedule, socould be just after :pm.Where can I watch Nicola Sturgeons Covid briefing You can watch the first ministersCovid update via the Scottish governments social media s.It will also be broadcast on BBC Scotland from :pm, and the statement is usually live tweeted from the SNP Twitter handle.What will Nicola Sturgeon say today As always, we will hear an update of the case rates in Scotland, with the figures published daily at pm.The first minister is also likely to give an overview of what the government knows about Omicron and its presence in Scotland..removeIf any further measures are to be introduced to curb the spread of the iant, we are likely to hear about them at the briefing this afternoon.

title: yorkshire-building-society-donate-1955-jedburgh-charity
story: JEDBURGH based charity Jed Hearts Here has received a donation of almost pound, from the Yorkshire Building Society Charitable Foundation after being nominated by colleagues at the Societyrsquos Berwick upon Tweed agency for financial support.Jed Hearts Here is a local charity run by volunteers based in Jedburgh.They started in  and their initiative was to raise funds to provide the local community with as many Public Access Defibrillatorsas possible.They also deliver training to the general public on how to work the PADrsquos should anyone ever find themselves in the situation of having to use one of these to assist in potentially saving someonersquos le until paramedics arrive.They work hard to fundraise to be able to provide this equipment  training to the community free of charge.The pound, donation to Jed Hearts Here will be used to purchase training equipment that will enable them to go out into the community at organised training events.Hope Leer, manager of Yorkshire Building Societyrsquos agency in Berwick upon Tweed, said: ldquoWe are proud to be able to support Jed Hearts Here in our community in the Scottish Borders with a donation from Yorkshire Building Society Charitable Foundation. The work that they are doing to support provide this le saving equipment is giving a real benefit to their local community.Lynn Dixon, chairperson of Jed Hearts Here, said: ldquoThis donation from Yorkshire Building Society Charitable Foundation will make a huge dference to our charity and to the Jedburgh Community. Fundraising has been so dficult during the Covid pandemic and this donation will allow us to move forward with our plans for CPR  defibrillator training at long last.ldquoA huge thank you to Hope for helping with our application and for all her supportYorkshire Building Society Charitable Foundation is funded through the Small Change Big Dferencereg scheme where members donate the pennies from the interest on their accounts just once a year to help smaller charities around the UK..removeIn , the Charitable Foundation donated pound, to  registered charities nominated by members and colleagues from around the UK.For more information about our Small Change Big Dferencereg scheme and to see an interactive map of recent Charitable Foundation donations visit www.ybs charitablefoundation

title: covid-scotland-nicola-sturgeon-update-say-today
story: Nicola Sturgeon gave her weekly update to Parliament today amid concerns surrounding the Omicron iant, describing the situation as "another serious moment" of the pandemic.Last week the Scottish government urged people to tighten their compliance with the rules in order to curb the spread of the iant.Scotland also introduced travel restrictions in a four nation approach with the other UK countries.Earlier on Tuesday prime minister Boris Johnson said that preliminaryindications suggested the new iant was more transmissible than Delta.This was addressed bythe first minister today who outlinedwhat scientists so far understand about Omicron.As Omicron continues to cause uncertainty in the run-up to Christmas, heres what we learned from Nicola Sturgeons Covid update today.... Current protections to remain in placeNo changes will be made to the current regulations, however the Scottish government wants the public to tighten compliance with the regulations.The ruleswill be monitored daily due to the new iant, with the government able to bring in further measuresrequired.The first minister said the Scottish government will seek to do what is necessary to prevent the problem, and will therefore "strive" to act both proportionately andpreventatively evenat the cost of popularity."For the Scottish Government, our first principle will be to seek to do what is necessary to keep the country as safe as possible, eventhat is sometimes at the expense of being popular."And second, we will strive to get the right balance between acting proportionately and acting preventatively.". Rise in overall number of casesCases have risen over the past -daysin all age cohorts under .The first minister said: "In total, cases amongst under s increased by % in the past week - and since people under  currently account for more than % of cases overall, that has inevitably driven an increase in the total number of cases recorded.".remove. More details on confirmed Omicron cases in Scotland coming tomorrowMore detailed information onthe number of Omicron cases in Scotland is due tomorrow.In the coming weeks, more data will become available on the hospitalisations and deaths linked to the Omicron iant, with the first minister saying: "In weeks to come - and as the quality of data allows - these reports will also provide details on the vaccination status of, and hospital admissions and deaths associated with, Omicron cases.". Ten fold increase in Omicron in a single weekOmicron cases in Scotland have increased from  to  cases in the space of a week.Like Boris Johnson this morning, Nicola Sturgeon also said that early evidence suggests that the Omicron iant is more transmissible than Delta.She warned to expect a rapid rise of cases in the coming days.. People asked to work from homeThe first minister urged employers whose employees were working from home earlier in the pandemic to allow them to do so again.This working from home advice will remain in place until the middle of January when it will be reviewed.. , new Covid casesOver , Covid cases were recorded over the past -hours, however this higher number of cases was due to a backlog of results which Public Health Scotland expects to clear today.people were in hospital yesterday with recently confirmed COVID-, while were in intensive care.

title: southdean-man-convicted-causing-serious-injury-cyclist
story: A -YEAR-OLD man has been convicted of causing serious injury to a cyclist by dangerous driving.It followed an accident on the A road at Southdean near the Carter Bar on June , .Anthony Chester, of North Shields, had pleaded not guilty to the charge.:Jedburgh based charity Jed Hearts Here get sizeable donation to help with their workBut he was found guilty following a trial at Edinburgh Sherf Court.Sentence has been deferred until December  for the production of background reports.

title: borders-recycling-go-northern-ireland-contract-agreed
story: A MULTI-MILLION pound contract will see household recycling in the Borders transported  miles to Northern Ireland.Scottish Borders Councilhas struck the pound. million agreement with Re-Gen Waste Ltd, of Newry, to deal with the ldquouplt, treatment and disposal of ldquoco-mingled mixed recyclate.It is predicted that , tonnes of kerbside recyclables ndash including paper, cardboard, cans and plastic ndash will be taken across the North Channel on an annual basis.Re-Gen Waste, the only bidders for the council contract, will replace JB Recycling, of Hartlepool.:Man jailed after causing disturbance at holiday chalets near Borders townOn the award, SBC waste manager Ross Sharp-Dent said: ldquoFollowing the expiry of our previous contract for the transport and processing of dry mixed recycling, a procurement exercise was undertaken by the council with the available contract put out to tender.ldquoThe successful company, Re-Gen, a Northern Ireland based recycling and waste management specialist, is a market leader in the processing of and recovery of recyclable materials and currently works for a number of other Scottish local authorities.ldquoThe contract will see Re-Gen provide the same service as our previous contractor and process all of the same materials for recycling. As a result there will be no change experienced by the public in terms of what can be put in their bins.":Storm Barra: Risk of more power cuts as Borders given yellow weather warningsMr Sharp-Dent added: ldquoIn  SBC achieved a total recycling rate of  per cent, representing an increase of over  per cent from the previous year and the largest increase of any local authority in Scotland.ldquoThis is signicantly higher than the national recycling averageand positions SBC as the highest performing rural local authority in Scotland.ldquoThe increase in recycling performance also coincides with a signicant reduction in the amount of waste reaching landfill and a reduction in carbon emissions of , tonnes COe between  and ..removeldquoRecycling is one of the easiest everyday actions we can take to reduce our carbon footprint and I would encourage members of the public to play their part. A new online  has been created to help people across the Scottish Borders recycle more by telling them what can and canrsquot be recycled in their area ndash https:wasteless.zerowastescotland.org.uk recycling-sorter.SBC is working with the contractor to ldquomaximise the tonnage for each journey to minimise haulage impacts.:Jedburgh based charity Jed Hearts Here get sizeable donation to help with their workThe local authority said that ldquobackload trips will ensure the vehicles are not running empty on either leg of their journey from Northern Ireland.Initially a three-year contract, there is an option of four one-year extensions.The contract is on a dferent pricing mechanism to the previous one, according to the council, with this one more strongly linked to market prices for materials.After the recycling is taken to Northern Ireland, the end product from the contractor will then be transported all over the world.

title: covid-scotland-work-home
story: Nicola Sturgeon is urgingthe Scottish workforce to workfrom home in the run-up to Christmas as the Omicron iant of Covid becomes more prevalent.In a statement on Tuesday afternoon, the First Minister asked employers to allow their staff to work from home where possible in order to help "stem transmission and avoid the need for even more onerous measures."She said: "We already advise people to work from home where practical. Today, I am asking employers to ensure this is happening."To be blunt,you had staff working from home at this start of the pandemic, please now enable them to do so again."We are asking you to do this from now until the middle of January when we will review this advice again."But who exactly was working from home at the start of the pandemic Heres what we know...Who is the Scottish Government asking to work from home The Scottish Government is asking anyone who worked from home at the start of the pandemic to do so once again until mid-January.At the beginningof the pandemic in March , Nicola Sturgeon said that it was up to employers to decideworking from home was feasible.Now, almost two years later, she is once again calling on employers to make the call.At the start of the pandemic, it was largely only key workerswho could go into work, while everyone  was told to work from home.Key workers were ided into three categories:Category Health and care workers directly supporting Covid response, and associated staffHealth and care workers supporting le-threatening emergency work, as well as critical primary and community care provisionEnergy suppliers and staff providing childcare learning for other Category  staff.Category All other health and care workers, and wider public sector workers providing emergency critical welfare services ,Those supporting our critical national infrastructure, without whom serious damage to the welfare of the people of Scotland could be caused..removeCategory All workerswithout whom there could be a signicant impact on Scotland Of course, at the start of the pandemic, non-essential businesses that could not operate from home were told to shut and their employees were put on furlough.This time mass closures have not been introduced meaning people working from home will largely be those who are office-based.How long is the work from home advice in place The work from home advice is in place until the middle of January according to the First Minister.In January, it will be reviewed again.Why hashome working been so strongly advised According to the First Minister, home working could play a key role in curbing the spread of Omicron.After asking people who worked at home at the beginning of the pandemic to do so again, she concluded: "Please - and I really hope this will be for one last time in this pandemic - letrsquos all pull together, do what is necessary, and get each other and the country through this winter and into what we all hope will be a better and brighter spring."

title: twice-postponed-graduation-ceremony-livestreamed
story: BORDERS Colleges graduation ceremonies took place this month in Kelso.The gatherings were live-streamed allowing family and friends who were unable to attend to join the celebrations virtually.The two-day event saw principal Angela Cox congratulate all graduands on their efforts.She said ldquoIt is with immense pride that I stand in front of you all today as principal of Borders College and I congratulate you all on your achievements. Staff, family and friends have watched you grow in confidence, develop new skills and now stand beside you as you prepare for the next stage of your career and development.Ms Cox also presented this yearrsquos Honorary Fellowships to Ross Dickinsonand Virginia Grant .Ross Dickinson set up his own company Kibosh Ltd in . He designed a ground-breaking and innovative pipe repair product, which is now sold throughout the world.The entrepreneur studied plumbing at the college and overcame dyslexia to achieve his many successes, including receiving the SNIPEF Apprentice of the Year Award in his second year.Kibosh Ltd, now based in Galashiels, has secured funding and support from the Net Zero Technology Centrein Aberdeen for the final stage of development of industrial pipe repair and high efficiency pipe freezing clamps.Virginia Grant is a former member of the regional board for Borders College. She and her husband Andrew run Riddell Estate, near Lilliesleaf.Virginia worked for as a lecturer and helped to develop the Business Development and Consultancy offer as managing director.While working at Borders College, she gained an MBA at Strathclyde Business School and was later recruited by Frontline Consultants. She then undertook a PhD at Strathclyde University Business School and set up her own consultancy company in .Virginia ran the firm until  and continues to provide coaching to businesses and iniduals..removeAll the graduates from Thursday and Fridayrsquos ceremonies are listed below.Borders College ndash Graduates nd December Department of Enterprise and Business InnovationWynter Raine title: coronavirus-borders-records-40-cases-24-hours
story: THE Borders has recorded  new cases of coronavirus in a -hour period, latest figures show.An update was published by the Scottish Government at pm today .And the new data shows that the Borders has now seen , coronavirus cases since the start of the pandemic.There are nine people in hospital in the Borders with recently confirmed cases of COVID-.Scotland has now recorded , cases since March last year.

title: farmhouse-took-decade-restore-named-house-year
story: A Georgianfarmhousewhich took  years to meticulously restore in a ldquolabour of love has been named House of the Year.House on the Hill, a Gloucestershirefarmhouseextension, was revealed as the winner in the final episode of the Channel  series Grand Designs: House of the Year on Wednesday.The three-storey stone farmhouse was converted into a gallery space for owners David andJenny and their art collection while the newtwo-storeywingis partiallyembedded into the hillside.The annual award, which was established in , is presented by the Royal Institute of British Architectsto the UKrsquos best new architect-designed house.Riba presidentSimon Allfordsaid:ldquoThis geometric design skilfully fuses together the old with the new ndash connecting two architectures separated by over  years.ldquoIntriguing and distinguished, House on the Hill is the impressive result of a -year collaboration between the homeowners and their architect. This isan extraordinarylabour of love in architectural form.ldquoEvery detail has been meticulously considered and exquisitely finished, resulting in a truly remarkable home that enhances its unique setting.The restored th farmhouse overlooks the Wye Valley in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.The owners of House on the Hill said:ldquoOurs was a very protracted project,so the clientandarchitect relationship had to be one of mutual confidence.vw,vw,px, px"House on the Hill took  years to restore ldquoThe interplay of the house and its gardens with the wider surrounds provides an ever-changing source of pleasure.ldquoThe house is in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and thehouseand the landscape complement each other. Toto the house after a spell away is to renew our admiration of the scheme.Previous winners of the top architectural prize include McGonigle McGrath for House Lessans in  and HaysomWardMiller for Lochside House in ..removeArchitectAmin Tahahair, of the Riba House of the Yearjury, said: ldquoSome decades in the making hellip The jury felt Alison Brooks Architects had applied their long-researched process of subtly breaking down the rigid and spatially predictable grid with gentle inflection.Architect Brooks designed anglesthroughout the house which wereintentionallyskewedand undulating, to echo the topography of the adjacent meadows.Brooksadded:ldquoItrsquos a real honour to win Riba House of the Year amongst an accomplished shortlist of beautul projects.ldquoI see private house commissions as a rare opportunity to test new ideas in a concentrated form ndash they are the built equivalent of writing an essay.ldquoSo,this accolade is a testament to my clientrsquos belief in the value of architecture and their willingness to embrace the new.The four-part series of Grand Designs: House of the Year showcased seven shortlisted properties, which included a s steel water tower which had been converted into a home in rural Norfolk..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Farmhouse that took a decade to restore named House of the Year

title: ministers-isolating-contact-australian-politician-tested-positive
story: Two Cabinet ministers are self-isolating after they were in contact with the Australian Deputy Prime Minister, who has tested positive for coronavirus.Justice Secretary Dominic Raab and Transport Secretary Grant Shapps met Barnaby Joyce in London earlier in the week.Mr Joyce has since tested positive while travelling to Washington DC and is self-isolating for  days.The news meant Mr Shapps had to pull out of an HS-related visit to Newton Ayclfe, County Durham, as he was due to mark a major contract signing with Hitachi to manufacture rolling stock.Sorry not to be travelling to @HitachiRailENGin County Durham today to welcome huge new @HSltdrolling stock contract. Have taken precaution of cancelling visit  have taken PCR test after being in contact with Australian Deputy PM this week ndash whos tested positive for Covid.mdash Rt Hon Grant Shapps MPDecember , Mr Shapps tweeted: ldquoSorry not to be travelling to @HitachiRailENG in County Durham today to welcome huge new @HSltd rolling stock contract.ldquoHave taken precaution of cancelling visit  have taken PCR test after being in contact with Australian Deputy PM this week ndash whorsquos tested positive for Covid.A spokeswoman for Mr Raab said: ldquoHe is getting tested and he is self-isolating while we wait to hear whether the Australian Deputy Prime Minister has Omicron or not.Mr Joyce, who is fully vaccinated, said in a Facebook post on Thursday that he had been experiencing mild symptoms and decided to get tested.He said he will remain in isolation while seeking further advice..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Ministers isolating after contact with Australian politician who tested positive

title: happens-prime-minister-resigns
story: There are mounting calls forBoris Johnson to resign amid the Downing Street Christmas parties scandal - but what actually happensa prime minister resigns Yesterday we saw the PMs former press officer Allegra Stratton step down after a video was leaked of her joking about the alleged party in a mock press conference on December  .The video has caused outrage up and down the country, however Boris Johnson has continued to deny any rules were broken in Downing Street while the country was in lockdown last year.Many political commentators have suggested that Stratton will not be the only one out of a job following this scandal, and the SNP as well as ious media outlets have calledfor Boris Johnsons resignation.But what happensa prime minister resigns Heres what you need to know...What happensa prime minister resigns in the UK It depends on the situation surrounding the resignation.If a prime minister resigns following the loss of a general election, they will offer their resignation to the monarch who will then invite the winning party to form agovernment in their name.However,a prime ministerresigns during a parliamentary sessionwhen their government is still in power and has not lost a general election, there is a dferent process.In this case, the government is still elected and therefore the resignation of the standing prime minister triggers a leadership contest, where fellow members of the government will campaign to be leader of the party.When the leadership contest is decided, the outgoing prime minister will go and offer their resignation to the Queen, and advise she appointsthe new leader of the party as prime minister.This new prime minister is not then required to hold a general election, but they often choose to soon after they take over.Have prime ministers resigned while parliament is sitting before Yes, this has happened a few times..removeWhen Tony Blair announced his resignation on May  , he triggereda Labour leadership contest.Gordon Brown received  nominations for leader, and hisonly opponent,John McDonnell, soon conceded defeat.On June  , Brown officially became prime minister of the UK.The same thing happened with David Camerons resignation on June  following the Brexitvote.Theresa May won the Conservative leadership contest after her being left the sole candidate.When May then announced she would resign on June  , another leadership contest was triggered, resulting in the election of Boris Johnson over Jeremy Hunt.

title: winter-solstice-shortest-day-year-2021
story: As the winter months roll in, the nights are drawing longer and the days shorter - meaning thewinter solstice is just around the corner.The winter solstice marks the shortest day of the year in the UK when we have the fewest hours of daylight.The good newsis that after its over, the days continuously get longer until the summer solstice in June.Heres what you need to know about the shortest day in the UK in ...When is the winter solstice in  The winter solstice will take place on Tuesday December  .On this day, Scotlandwill only see around hours  minutes of daylight.Why does the winter solstice happen The winter solstice occurs in the UK when the north pole reaches its maximum tilt away from the sun.While it only happens once a year in the UK, it happens twice a year across the globe, once in the northern hemisphere and once in the southern hemisphere.The term winter solstice actually refers to the exact moment the earth is tilted furthest away from the sun, however it is also sometimes used to describe the day this occurs.During the winter solstice in the northern hemisphere, the further north you travelthe darker it will be.On December  , the north pole will remain dark for the entire day.From this day onwards, the days will gradually grow longer until the summer solstice six months later, following which the days will again begin to shorten.When is summer solstice The next summer solstice will take place on Tuesday June   in the northern hemisphere, marking the longest day of the year.Summer solstice is when the earth is tilted closest to the sun and is the opposite of the winter solstice.

title: covid-scotland-booster-jabs-appear-vaccine-passports-december-9
story: Scotlands deputy first minister confirmed this morning that the Covid booster jab will appear on Scottish vaccine passports for internationaltravel from December .Speaking on Good Morning Scotland, John Swinney said that proof of the booster jab would appear on vaccine passports for international travel from Thursday December .He added that this would be extended to the domestic vaccine certicationscheme, however this would take slightly longer to implement.When asked whether booster jabs would be included in the vaccine passport scheme, the deputy first minister said: "For international travelit will from  December."And we will expand that for domestic certication but that will take us a little more time to do that. But the critical requirement is for international travel and those changes will be applied from  December."Why is it important that boosters show on vaccine passports To travel to some countries, you must have been fully vaccinated against Covidwithin a certain time limitprior to your visit, which ranges from -days to a year.With Covid jabs rolled out from late last year, it means that some people will already be barred from travelthey cannot provide proof of a booster jab.Proof of a booster jab will therefore help people to meet the vaccination requirements of certain countries.Who can get a booster jab in Scotland All adults in Scotland will be offered a booster vaccine as advised by the JCVI after results showed a third vaccine signicantly improved protection against serious infection.The booster jabs aim to curb a potentialwave of infections caused by the Omicron iant.So far, everyone aged  and over and people who are clinically vulnerable have been invited to book their booster jabs in Scotland.But soon, everyone over the age of  will beable to book a booster jab.These third doses will be offered no less than three months after the second dose of the vaccine was administered..removeThis time frame between second vaccine and booster jab has been cut from six months to three, as advised by the JCVI.

title: nicola-sturgeon-update-say-today
story: Nicola Sturgeon gave her weekly update to Parliament today amid concerns surrounding the Omicron iant, describing the situation as "another serious moment" of the pandemic.Last week the Scottish government urged people to tighten their compliance with the rules in order to curb the spread of the iant.Scotlandalso introduced travel restrictions in a four nation approach with the other UK countries.Earlier on Tuesday prime minister Boris Johnson said that preliminaryindications suggested the new iant was more transmissible than Delta.This was addressed bythe first minister today who outlinedwhat scientists so far understand about Omicron.As Omicron continues to cause uncertainty in the run-up to Christmas, heres what we learned from Nicola Sturgeons Covid update today.... Current protections to remain in placeNo changes will be made to the current regulations, however the Scottish government wants the public to tighten compliance with the regulations.The ruleswill be monitored daily due to the new iant, with the government able to bring in further measuresrequired.The first minister said the Scottish government will seek to do what is necessary to prevent the problem, and will therefore "strive" to act both proportionately andpreventatively evenat the cost of popularity."For the Scottish Government, our first principle will be to seek to do what is necessary to keep the country as safe as possible, eventhat is sometimes at the expense of being popular."And second, we will strive to get the right balance between acting proportionately and acting preventatively.". Rise in overall number of casesCases have risen over the past -daysin all age cohorts under .The first minister said: "In total, cases amongst under s increased by % in the past week - and since people under  currently account for more than % of cases overall, that has inevitably driven an increase in the total number of cases recorded.".remove. More details on confirmed Omicron cases in Scotland coming tomorrowMore detailed information onthe number of Omicron cases in Scotland is due tomorrow.In the coming weeks, more data will become available on the hospitalisations and deaths linked to the Omicron iant, with the first minister saying: "In weeks to come - and as the quality of data allows - these reports will also provide details on the vaccination status of, and hospital admissions and deaths associated with, Omicron cases.". Ten fold increase in Omicron in a single weekOmicron cases in Scotland have increased from  to  cases in the space of a week.Like Boris Johnson this morning, Nicola Sturgeon also said that early evidence suggests that the Omicron iant is more transmissible than Delta.She warned to expect a rapid rise of cases in the coming days.. People asked to work from homeThe first minister urged employers whose employees were working from home earlier in the pandemic to allow them to do so again.This working from home advice will remain in place until the middle of January when it will be reviewed.. , new Covid casesOver , Covid cases were recorded over the past -hours, however this higher number of cases was due to a backlog of results which Public HealthScotland expects to clear today.people were in hospital yesterday with recently confirmed COVID-, while were in intensive care.

title: minato-sushi-cheese-lady-boost-haddington-town-centre
story: The Cheese Lady on Haddington High Street is moving into the former butcher premises of Colin D Peat on neighbouring Court Street.The move from High Street has opened the door for Minato Sushi to bring the Japanese delicacy to the town centre.The changing face of the town centre was welcomed by councillors Tom Trotter and John McMillan, with the new businesses set to open this summer.Jen Kerr, of Minato Sushi, stressed there was still plenty of work ahead at the business before the doors opened.The -year-old, of Port Seton, who will run the business with her boyfriend Tom Cuddy, described it as ldquoa real dream come true.She said: ldquoWe are really excited. It is quite a big town centre in East Lothian and has quite a erse mix of businesses there already. It seems nice and some people have been coming up and chatting to me and other shop owners have been quite friendly.Meanwhile, Svetlana Kukharchuk ndash The Cheese Lady ndash has ambitious plans for the former butchers having found a home for her business in the town nearly four years ago.She said: ldquoWe needed more space and wanted to expand so we can offer more space to our customers to shop more conveniently.ldquoWe want to mature our own cheeses and we are going to have a maturation room.ldquoAlso, Irsquom hoping to offer a few tables, which still needs to be confirmed with the council, where people can sit down and order a flight of cheese and a glass of wine.Svetlana, who previously had a business in St Andrews, moved to East Lothian in November  and opened her High Street shop.The business has proven a popular addition to the town centre, offering cheeses from throughout Europe, including Italy, France, Spain, Switzerland and Norway.Mr Trotter was pleased with the announcement regarding the two businesses.He said: ldquoWhoever thought a cheese shop in Haddington that, after this time, needed bigger premises  Thatrsquos fantastic.ldquoAnd it is incredible we are getting a sushi shop.Fellow ward member Mr McMillan was pleased with the level of interest from people looking to open up businesses in the town.He said: ldquoI think we are in a good place.ldquoWhen we were growing up, we did not know what sushi was!

title: youngsters-12-hour-non-stop-relay-boosts-walk-scott-foundation
story: Mary Kidd spent a day running, cycling, skipping and more in aid of the Walk With Scott Foundation.The -hour non-stop relay on May  has collected more than pound,, which will go to the Tranent-based charity.Proud mum Karen is secretary of the Walk With Scott Foundation, which was set up by after-dinner speaker Scott Glynn to mark his th birthday.Karen thanked everyone who sponsored her -year-old daughter, who also undertook a fundraiser for the charity last year during lockdown.Karen said: ldquoWe are all so very proud of Mary once again, with her amazingly crazy two fundraising events.ldquoMary has raised a fantastic pound, for the Walk with Scott Foundation and I know first-hand how much these funds are going to help others across our communities.Last year, the primary six pupil at Cockenzie Primary School completed a six-hour TikTok marathon, which raised pound, for the Walk With Scott Foundation.: Familys television appearanceThe success of the fundraiser even caught the attention of former Spandau Ballet and EastEnders star Martin Kemp and his son Roman. Mary and Karen were joined by dad Gordon and older sister Abbie on Martin and Romanrsquos Sunday Best TV show to discuss the success of the event.However, Mary was not content to put her feet up and was once again doing her bit for the good cause.Speaking ahead of the latest fundraiser, Mary said: ldquoThis year I want to double the time, and plan to do a -hour non-stop fun relay up and down our Lorimer Lane at the back of my house.ldquoIrsquom walking, running, skipping, hopping, jumping, scootering, cycling, skating, football dribbling, swing ball, space hopping and, of course, TikTok-ing!People can still sponsor Mary by going to uk.virginmoneygiving marysfunrelay

title: winter-wonderland-coming-gosford-house-december
story: Gosford House, near Longniddry, will play host to Scotlandrsquos newest Winter Wonderland between December  and .Event designers Rogue Village and Rogue City will create a vintage-inspired Christmas experience befitting of its historic backdrop featuring a Victorian carousel and chair swings, Christmas land train trips around the grounds, carnival stalls, marketplace, donkeys and a Christmas tree post-box maze.Jenner Maniam, Rogue Village co-director, said: ldquoWersquore creating something that captures the magic of Christmas ndash something that makes everyone feel like a six-year-old on Christmas Eve.ldquoThis year more than most we want people to be able to be socialise with loved ones in a safe environment.Those wishing to explore inside the incredible Gosford House can book a house tour or take part in workshops and festive activities.These include Christmas table styling by Style Your Spaces, whisky tasting from Glenkinchie, wreath making from Feathergrass Florals and ballet classes from Art East, former Royal Ballet principal dancers.Alison Bombail, Gosford venue manager, added: ldquoWe want to bring an authentic Christmas experience to our locality, while celebrating the local talent we are so lucky to be surrounded with.ldquoWe also hope to see lots of families joining in the festive cheer.Some of Scotlands leading independent food and drink producers, artists and designers will be available at the market stalls.Traders will include Bon Tot, The Portobello Bookshop and Dook.Peter Maniam, co-director, said: "Wersquore steering away from the strangely traditional German market and creating a marketplace that is representative of the incredible independent brands here in Scotland."We want to encourage spending and supporting local."The food and drink area sponsored by Wemyss Malts will include cosy tipi tents complete with open fire.Food and drink will be provided by Steampunk Coffee, Herringbone, Fox Hat, Wild at Heart and The Wee Green Van.To book tickets or for more information visit www.roguevillage gosford-house-winterwonderland

title: musselburgh-duos-gardening-exploits-see-become-internet-stars
story: Eli Appleby-Donald, , and we KathrynAppleby-Donald, , have created a YouTube channel and website ndash The Kitchen Garden with Eli and Kate ndash aimed at making gardening ldquosimple, easy and fun for everyone.From the garden in the Honest Toun, Eli, a digital teaching specialist at the University of Edinburgh, and Kate, head of collections at the Scottish Parliament, have produced more than  videos which focus on gardening, growing food and flowers.Their YouTube channel now has , subscribers, attracting about , views from  countries.Eli said: ldquoWe had a website and blog that we started back in  when we moved into this house.ldquoAlthough, to be honest, we did it for family to keep them updated and never expected anyone other than our family to read it.ldquoKatersquos mum had been diagnosed with Alzheimerrsquos, so the blog was meant as a way for her to see what we were doing.ldquoWe were really surprised when we started getting messages from folk who had found it and enjoyed it.She said: ldquoWe started making videos to share on the blog, again thinking only a few folk who read the blog would watch them.ldquoBut towards the end of , we started to get a lot more people watching the videos than reading the blog, so I tried to learn a bit more about making videos to make them better.ldquoWhen Covid hit and we all went into lockdown, I really missed being in the classroom but I had been working with students who donrsquot normally delve into the digital world and Irsquod been teaching them to make videos and blog.ldquoI was hearing from them about how much that meant to them to have this outlet while they were locked down and I realised that I was getting something similar from YouTube.Eli said they had done a lot on greenhouse growing because, when they started, they were growing tomatoes and peppers.She added: ldquoI also talk about how to grow from seed to save money because itrsquos a lot cheaper than buying plants.ldquoWersquove done some cooking videos, too ndash things like making passata with the tomatoes yoursquove grown or we did easy sourdough during lockdown.She added: ldquoThe videos are meant as a lsquofriend in the garden with yoursquo idea.ldquoWe only make videos about what we are doing in the garden and specically for growing in Scotland.The couple, who got married in their garden, have covered topics such as mulch, how to sharpen your garden tools, how to get your tomatoes to ripen, how to monitor greenhouse temperatures and composting.Eli said: ldquoIt wasnrsquot until we moved to Musselburgh that I fell in love with gardening.ldquoWhen we bought the house, there werenrsquot really any gardens. The front had been paved over and the back was just a lawn. So, I think we were maybe lucky that we got to design our garden to suit us and start from scratch. It helped fire the passion for gardening, I think.ldquoIrsquove been absolutely astounded at how many amazing folk watch our videos every week. We have had loads of lovely messages from folk saying how much theyrsquove enjoyed learning to garden with us over lockdown and beyond, and how wersquove taken the fear out of it.ldquoThere were even a few messages that made me cry where people have talked about their personal situations and what joy they get from our videos, and how they have made me a part of their weekly ritual.ldquoFolk from all over the world seem to really connect with what we are doing and how we are teaching in our videos, so itrsquos lovely when we get messages telling us what itrsquos been like in their towns and countries, and wersquove made some lovely friends from the US and Canada to Australia, India and even Thailand.ldquoIrsquom so, so glad that folk have found happiness and comfort in our daftness.Catch up with Eli and Kate at youtube c TheKitchenGardenwithEliandKate or thekitchengardenwitheliandkate

title: man-ordered-good-behaviour-pushing-partner
story: David Morley acted in an aggressive manner and pushed the woman on the body at their home at Lydgait in Haddington.Edinburgh Sherf Court was told that Morley, , and the woman both worked for the same bank and their relationship was to continue.Sherf Matthew Auchincloss heard that Morley had been attending counselling and ordered the first offender to stay out of trouble until he appeared back at court next May. Sentence was deferred for good behaviour.Morley admitted an amended charge of behaving in a threatening or abusive manner by acting in an aggressive manner and pushing a woman on the body on July .

title: brave-teenager-leukaemia-returns-school-first-time
story: Aidan Hogg, , of Arrow Crescent, Musselburgh, has been mainly bed-bound at Edinburghrsquos Royal Hospital for Children and Young Peoplesince he was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia in March.Aidan is now making weekly visits to his family home as he continues to receive intense physiotherapy in hospital.His mum, Emma Davidson, said the Preston Lodge High School pupil was delighted toto his high school for the first time in eight months for a short visit.The teenager dropped by for  minutes to visit staff members, who his mum said ldquohe was desperate to see and thank for all their support.Staff and students at the high school recently banded together to raise funds for Aidanrsquos Magical Gts ndash a project set up by the youngster to provide Christmas gts for over  children at RHCYP.Following a dress down day at the school in October, a representative was proud to announce that pound had been raised for the cause, with a generous donation of pound from a friend of the school bringing the total amount to pound,.Julia Robertson, deputy headteacher, said: ldquoWith those funds we are buying an advent door from the Edinburgh Childrenrsquos Hospital Charity, who organise fun things for children and young people in hospital, and  Amazon gt cards for the gt bags.ldquoWersquore looking forward to welcoming Aidan back into school soon too!Recently, Aidan underwent an important milestone in his recovery when he had his port removed.Installed  weeks ago, the port administered chemotherapy, fluids, antibiotics, and food when the teenager was too unwell to eat.Emma added: ldquoSo many times we have seen him hooked up to dferent things through that port.ldquoI know itrsquos been amazing for the staff to get the things he needs into his body the fastest way but I canrsquot say I will be sad to see it go.ldquoI was so nervous for the surgery but also happy for him and for us all.

title: fate-rail-underpass-depends-new-housing-scheme-decision-dunbar
story: Hundreds of new homes have been built at Hallhill, south of the railway line, in Dunbar in recent years.However, pedestrian links between the new homes and the older section of Dunbar are limited.East Lothian Council is keen to see a new pedestrian underpass to improve connections, which could be financed in part through another housing development in the area.It is expected that the cost of the underpass would be more than pound million, with part of the cost being covered by the Hallhill North development, which would consist of  houses and  flats.A decision is set to be made on the plans, which come from Taylor Wimpey East Scotland and Hallhill Developments Limited, at a meeting of East Lothian Councilrsquos planning committee on Tuesday.Councillor Norman Hampshire, who chairs the local authorityrsquos planning committee and represents Dunbar on East Lothian Council, noted that currently the only pedestrian access in the area was under the railway line beside Hallhill Sports Centre.He said: ldquoAs part of the application, the developer will be making a contribution to a new underpass at the railway.ldquoThere will not be enough funding coming from the developer to completely do this underpass.ldquoThat has to be done through grant funding from other agencies and the council themselves.ldquoAt the moment, all the houses from the Hallhill area to get to both the lower primary school and secondary school have to come underneath the tunnel, and children going to the Lochend Campus have to come back through that one.ldquoIt is really congested and we definitely need another way through there.An underpass was previously in place under the railway line but it was blocked up a number of years ago.Network Rail was approached about seeing it reopened but was not keen on the idea and East Lothian Council would have been liable for the structure.Mr Hampshire said: ldquoWe have to go with a completely new cut-through for pedestrians and cyclists, which will come through into Ash Grove swing park area but will be a safe route to get to the secondary school.Drawings and documents for the planning application were first submitted to East Lothian Councilrsquos planning department at the beginning of February last year.The scheme, to the west of the primary schoolrsquos Lochend Campus, originally featured  houses and  apartments.

title: musselburgh-grammar-school-host-first-outdoor-christmas-market
